Working out of the old Moslem castle in Calatrava, they will be one of the vanguards against the dangers to the faith, and make sure the Iberian peninsula never again fall to heathens and infidels.\n\nThough they are willing to follow the orders of [From.GetTitledName] for now, their loyalty lies with [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] first and foremost.

This chivalric order owes its name to Santiago Matomoros, the legendary Saint appearing at the battle of Clavijo to help the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s against the Moslem infidels. The [d_knights_santiago.GetName] was formed by the benevolent [From.GetTitledName] in [From.GetHerHis] bountiful wisdom, and all its members have vowed to protect the pilgrims traveling the Way of Saint James.\n\nBlessed and sponsored by the [From.Religion.GetName] church itself, they will fight at the forefront of the struggles to keep Iberia [From.Religion.GetGroupName].

The Order of the Brothers of the German House of Saint Mary in Jerusalem has been formed, sponsored by the [From.Religion.GetName] church and [From.GetTitledName]. The Teutonic Order primarily protect and care for pilgrims to the Holy Land, but will serve [From.Religion.GetName] rulers willing to pay for their upkeep.\n\nThough they only fight to protect the pilgrims for now, there is already ambitious murmurs in the order about what the future might bring.
The infidels come in many flavors.
I should consider preparing my men.

The announcement about the grand Crusade was sent to every [From.Religion.GetName] realm, but apparently to no avail. The Pope has been trying to gather up support for the Crusade for months, but now the Vatican has gone quiet, as the Vicar of Christ has given up on his Crusade.\n\nThe [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s seem more interested with infighting than fighting the heathens or infidels outside their own borders. The Crusade was officially canceled, as the Pope held a large announcement denouncing the [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Lords and Ladies for their ineptitude in the matters of Faith. Now it is only a matter of time until [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] forsakes his faithless followers, and leaves them to be conquered by the sacrilegious infidels, blasphemers and heathens.
A terrible day for all of us.

Dear [Root.GetTitledName]
It has come to my attention you have not yet put on the cross. I have decided that it is time for you to pay back the favor you owe me, and be part of this endeavor.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I guess I will go then...

[pleased_courtier.GetFirstName] approaches me as I am on my way out, to tell me how happy [pleased_courtier.GetSheHe] was to hear I had pledged my men to the Crusade, and wish me luck in the upcoming war.

I receive a letter from [pleased_participant.GetTitledName], with a well detailed approval of my decision to join the upcoming Crusade. Maybe this is a chance to get closer as we fight the the heathens together?
Let us fight the heathens together!

I receive a letter from the despicable [pleased_participant.GetTitledName]. As we are both going to participate in the upcoming Crusade for [crusade_title.GetName], [pleased_participant.GetSheHe] wants us to make amends and move on from our disagreements.
Maybe it is for the better.

I have been unable to stop myself from being somewhat excited at the prospect of the driving away the infidels from [crusade_title.GetName], and restoring peace to those lands. I have not usually felt this inspired as a [Root.Religion.GetGroupName], but maybe I am changing?

Knowing I will be gone for a while, I decide to spend a day with the local sea creature while I still can. It comes up with some great battle plans I can use in the upcoming wars for [crusade_title.GetName]. I am blessed to have such a good friend.

I drop by the local forest, to spend some hours with the beasts and fauna before I leave home. I end up having a fruitful discussion with, well, I am not entirely sure what it is, but the conversation was enlightening!
I am inspired to do my utmost.
An eye for your wisdom, you say?
We will see each other again!

[displeased_courtier.GetFirstName] explains to me in great detail exactly how disappointed [displeased_courtier.GetSheHe] is in my decision to leave the Crusade. After the long tirade [displeased_courtier.GetSheHe] finally leaves the room, and I get some time for myself.
Maybe it wasn't the right decision after all.

I received a letter from the esteemed [displeased_participant.GetTitledName]. It seems [displeased_participant.GetSheHe] is displeased in my decision to revoke the pledge I made to the Crusade, and finds me somewhat untrustworthy.

One of my messengers brings me a letter from [displeased_participant.GetTitledName], where [displeased_participant.GetSheHe] declares me an unreliable swine and a traitor to all [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
I have noticed that neither you nor your troops have partaken in the Crusade you pledged to join. I am disgusted that you would dare to lie about something like this, and expect your troops to show up soon.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
You have already received one warning, and clearly not taken heed. I consider your lack of faith and interest in keeping your promise to be unbecoming of a Christian ruler.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName].

Messengers are sent to every corner of the world, as the Pope furiously excommunicates the despicable and vile [unpledging_actor.GetTitledName]. [unpledging_actor.GetSheHeCap] is expelled from the faith for forsaking [unpledging_actor.GetHerHis] fellow [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s in their righteous war for [crusade_title.GetName].\n\n[unpledging_actor.GetTitledName] should not be helped, cared for nor forgiven. A traitor to the faith as well as to the cause, the only thing [unpledging_actor.GetSheHe] deserves is to be justifiably overthrown. A true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] would not betray [unpledging_actor.GetHerHis] allies to fight the heathens alone.

[Root.GetTitledName]
I noticed you still have not pledged to the Cross. As a faithful [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] ruler, I hope and pray that you will reconsider your actions, and join in the righteous war for [crusade_title.GetName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Yes, you are right your Holiness.

After the long fought battle for [new_crusader_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], it has finally been restored to the faith. [new_crusader_king.GetDynName] has stepped up to the throne as the beneficiary of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], becoming the [new_crusader_king.GetKingQueen] of the Crusader State. Surely it will be hard to continue fighting at the fringe of Christendom, but everyone can agree [new_crusader_king.GetTitledFirstName] is the right person for the task.\n\nThe Pope requests that the rest of the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] world support this new Kingdom as best they can, and not let it once more fall to the infidels and heathens.
If only it could have been me...

[Root.GetTitledName]
I know we have had our differences, but it pleases me to hear you have decided to join our rightful cause. I have made the preparations to recant your excommunication from the church.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

The victories against the infidels were hard-fought, but things have finally settled down and the titles I fought for were given to [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetDynName]. It will surely be difficult to be a part of the new Kingdom, but I wish [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetHerHim] luck in [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetHerHis] future endeavors.\n\nI look back one last time as my men and I leave [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. I wonder what life would have been like if it had been me staying here, rather than [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetDynName].
Maybe in another life, it could have been me.

Greetings, [Root.GetTitledName]

I was informed the heathen Pope have declared a will to bring a Crusade to your doorsteps. As a fellow [From.Religion.GetName], I pledge to stand by your side when the unfaithful come to take your lands.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
How much gold should I donate to the Crusade?
I hope the Pope will appreciate this gesture.
A grand gift befitting my station!
I simply can not afford to donate anything...
I need to make a decision, if I should comply with Papal will, or go my own way when it comes to the distribution of the titles in the case of a victory in the Crusades.
I will let the Pope decide.
My beneficiary will get the titles.
Why would I give MY titles away?
I will stick to my previous decision.
Sadly, my beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have died, I need to find a new one.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have gained land, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have become an heir for a landed title, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have become a mercenary, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have joined a holy order, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! is not old enough, and is therefore not an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! is not healthy enough to be an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! have become a [old_crusade_beneficiary.GetAscetic], and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See no longer supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], but rather [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. The Holy See now support [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] to be granted the titles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. The Holy See now supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetHerHis] heir [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the throne.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See has decided to start supporting you as the recipient for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], after the death of [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See has decided to start supporting you as the recipient for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See no longer supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName]. With no fitting ruler, I will let you faithful men and women of the Cross decide who these titles might befit.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. With no fitting ruler available, I will let you faithful men and women of the Cross decide who will receive these titles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I might have someone in mind.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
The Vatican is deeply disappointed in your decision to not join the Crusade. Your lack of faith is shocking, and I thought one could think better of a ruler such as you. 

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
I decide what is best for my people, not you.

[From.Religion.GetHighGodName] has granted [new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetTitledName] victory in the Crusade for [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName]. [new_crusade_target_char.GetTitledName] has been beaten at every turn through the war, and [new_crusade_target_char.GetSheHe] has finally had to give up on [new_crusade_target_char.GetHerHis] holdings in [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName].

[Root.GetCrusadeSelfishOrNot]

With the [new_crusade_target_char.Religion.GetGroupName]s being pushed out of their old lands, there are certainly more conflicts to come.

My men storm the walls of [From.GetBaseName], and finally take the last proper bastion of [duchy_region.GetBaseName]. If I settled my men around the area they could probably support the ongoing Crusade and help us claim victory, but the Pope will not be pleased if I unrightfully take these lands for myself.
[duchy_region.GetBaseName] sounds like an appropriate part of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
I will find a suitable ruler for this new land.
I have no interest in these lands.

The [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Crusaders have taken [duchy_region.GetBaseName] and settled their soldiers around the area. Though the Crusade for [crusade_title.GetName] is still ongoing, the area around [duchy_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [current_crusade_beneficiary.GetTitledName].\n\nEmboldened and supported by the new [current_crusade_beneficiary.GetLordLady] of [duchy_region.GetBaseName], the Crusaders fight harder than ever to conquer [crusade_title.GetName]. It is only a matter of time before the rest of the [crusade_target_ruler.Religion.GetGroupName] realms will fall.
I wonder what life would have been like in [duchy_region.GetBaseName].

The old title of [old_crusade_title.GetName] has often been considered somewhat illegitimate in the eyes of everyone else. Now that I have acquired a new title it might be time to leave the old title behind, to take on the mantle of a more appropriate legitimate title.
Legitimize [old_crusade_title.GetName] as the new rightful Duchy of the region. This will delegitimize the old Duchy of [duchy_title.GetName].
The title has served us well. Rest, old friend.
Legitimate or not, I will keep the title.
Disappointing that anyone can be so self-serving.

As I pass through [current_location.GetName], I come across [other_crusader.GetTitledName]. [other_crusader.GetSheHeCap] invites me to spend some time in [other_crusader.GetHerHis] camp to get to know one another better, as we are allies in the Crusade for [crusade_title.GetBaseName].
Thank you, I will accept your offer.
I am here to fight the infidels, not to make friends.
The last few days here in [current_location.GetName] has been an interesting experience. The [current_location.Culture.GetName] culture has reminded me of how different these lands are to my home.
I should try to learn as much as I can about these lands while I still can!
I will try to befriend one of the locals.
It looks like an abandoned battlefield, the dead strewn across the landscape. The crusaders certainly met quite the resistance, here in [current_location.GetName].
Maybe I could salvage some valuables?
A local merchant caravan approaches me on its way back home to [current_location.GetName]. One of the peddlers flashes me a huge grin, and ask if I want to take a look at his wares.
Thank you, but I have to be on my way.

When I joined the Crusade for [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName], I never expected the loneliness and longing for home. My men look up to me, so I have to continue the facade that everything is all right, as we move ever closer to our goal.
Maybe I just need to try to relax, and stop overworking myself.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] will guide me through these hardships.
As we settle down for the night in [current_location.GetName], a comet passes overhead. The soldiers start talking excitedly what it might mean.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] guides our hand in this just war!
All right, now get back to work men.
Let us take a moment to thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] for this miracle.

A group of Crusaders have beheaded several of the locals in [current_location.GetName], for no other reason than them being [current_location.Religion.GetName]. Was this really why we came to [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName]?

As we pass through [current_location.GetName], we come across a small group of [Root.GetCrusadeReligiousMinorityGroup]. They happily receive us as long lost brothers and sisters, and give us a place to sleep and rest for the night.
Let me help you spread your faith, friends.
Would you like to join my court back in [Root.Capital.GetName]?

I find myself walking through the ancient streets of Rome. Once a part of the Roman Empire, then a part of the Papal States. It used to be the very center of the world, and the core lands of the faith. Now it is not even [Root.Religion.GetName].

Once a bastion of the faith, Antioch has fallen from greatness. I look around the city and see the potential to become a center of the faith once more, it if is led by a true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName].
One day, it will live up to the name Theopolis once more.
We will restore the city of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

Once Saint Paul walked across the shores of Cyprus to spread the faith of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but now it has been lost to the infidels. If only we could restore it as a place of faith and virtue.
Sadly, the island has been lost...
For the glory of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] we fight!
Jerusalem, the beating heart of the faith, has been filled with infidels. Everywhere I look, I see men and women who are clearly not of the faith. The shame stings me to the very depths of my heart.

The bitter losses in the previous Crusade are still lingering across the Christian lands. The messengers of the Pope have traveled across all the faithful realms of the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s to spread the Crusader spirit among the people, but the nobility has tired from the previous war.\n\nWith the Pope at the forefront, small revolts have occurred as the people want to reconquer the holy places of the faith, with the lords and ladies somewhat skeptical. It is most likely only a matter of time before a larger conflict between the masses and the nobility will take place.
This is not going to end well...

With a bellowing shout, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName] launches the Crusade of poor souls from [shepherds_province.GetName]. Men and women from all across the [shepherds_province.Culture.GetName] lands have gathered to witness this momentous event, with not a single lord or lady to lead them, nor to be seen among the populace.

Supposedly guided by the hand of [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName], [shepherds_leader.GetSheHe] commands the shepherds, fletchers and blacksmiths apprentices to march towards [kingdom_target.GetBaseName]. It is a long and perilous path, with many challenges waiting for them. Without supply lines nor help from the locals, they are unlikely to ever reach their destination.

Can the miracles of [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName] truly save them from the fate everyone expects them to have?

[From.GetFirstName] finally had [From.GetHerHis] people stand down as the losses against [FromFrom.GetTitledName] proved to be too costly. Most of the army were executed right there and then, and [From.GetFirstName] brought back to [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] to show everyone what happens to peasants who try to attack their betters.\n\nAfter all, nobody ever believed the peasants would win against the battle hardened armies of [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

With pitchforks and hammers in hand, the shepherds rush the final bastions of defense in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. The skeptics were many, but nobody could make the miraculous group of brave men and women stop their quest for the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] lands.\n\nThe rest of the world looks to the new [From.GetKingQueen] with awe and confusion, as [From.GetDynName] takes the throne for [From.GetHerselfHimself]. Peasant no more, nobody can deny [From.GetHerHis] right to the throne. For who else than [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] could have guided [From.GetTitledFirstName] to victory?

Without the guidance of [From.GetFirstName], the men and women of the aptly named Shepherds' Crusade have started to fall apart. [From.GetHerHisCap] death broke the morale of the peasant army, and they have fled to all the corners of the world.\n\nAfter all, who ever truly believed the peasants could conquer anything on their own?
The massive army of peasants have gathered outside of my doorstep at [current_location.GetName]. Their commander, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName], is asking me for aid in their Crusade.
They are free to pass through, but do it quickly.
I will send you some of my men.

The troublemakers of the peasant Crusade have demanded that I expel all the Jews from the realm. According to their leader, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName], they are not true believers in [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName].

As expected, the rebellious peasants of the Shepherds' Crusade have started causing chaos among the local populace of [current_location.GetName]. My people look to me, to stop these foreign elements intruding upon our lands.
It is probably safer to just let them pass through.
Threading upon my lands is punishable by death.

As the Shepherds' Crusade passes by [current_location.GetName], I see an influx of peasants settle down in the area. It seems some of them reconsider their choices, as the Crusade still has a way to go.
We could always use a helping hand or two.
Deserters have no place in [current_location.GetName], get back to the Crusade!
After publicly declaring the Shepherds' Crusade a heretical group of pillagers, [local_bishop.GetTitledName] was executed at the hands of [From.GetFirstName].
It is time to put an end to them.

The cursed [From.Religion.GetName] peasants have entered [current_location.GetName] and have started causing issues among the people. If this keeps going, it is only a matter of time before chaos will ensue.
It is probably just better to wait for them to leave.
I will fight them off myself!

My dear [Root.GetTitledName]
The knights have been looking for somewhere easily defensible, where we can help guide all [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] souls to the Holy Land. We think your newfound lands in [potential_title.GetBaseName] might be the perfect location, and we would pay you for your troubles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write you this letter to inform you that me and my men have officially left your service. We no longer see you fit to rule, and we have once more returned to the faithful service of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

The magnanimous [From.GetTitledName] has donated the island of [potential_title.GetBaseName] to the Knights of Saint John, better known as the Knights Hospitaller. As one of the long standing protectors of the faith, this will surely make the routes safer for all the pilgrims seeking the Holy Land. The order is now known as the Knights of [potential_title.GetBaseName], and [d_knights_hospitaler.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] vows to continue their mission as the righteous defenders of Christianity and its faithful followers.

[Root.GetTitledName]
We wish to finally root out our ancient enemies in the north, and your newfound lands of [holy_order_potential_title.GetBaseName] would help us greatly in this mission. We would re-compensate you for your troubles, as we would not dare insult one with your status.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I would be happy to help the [d_teutonic_order.GetName]!
My apologies, but these lands are my own.

Supported by the charitable [From.GetTitledName], the Teutonic Order has settled down in [holy_order_potential_title.GetBaseName]. Dedicated to removing the northern infidels once and for all, [d_teutonic_order.Holder.GetTitledName] has started a massive campaign in order to revitalize [holy_order_potential_title.GetName] and turn it into a staging ground for their future wars.\n\nWorking out of [FromFrom.Capital.GetName], it is only a matter of time before they will conquer the rest of [kingdom_title.GetBaseName]. The heathens look towards the new seat of the Teutonic Order with fear and skepticism, knowing they will have to fight to retain their ungodly ways and traditions.
It is only a matter of time before they will fall.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The response is quite clear: The gods favor our cause in the war to come! The troops will fight with renewed strength now that they now for sure that our victory has been ordained from the heavens.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The signs are not entirely clear, but the diviner assures me that there was no signs of the Fates opposing our war. Our troops will surely be comforted by knowing that the gods are not against them.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. Unfortunately, the response from the diviner is not as positive as I hoped. There are clear signs that the gods are not in favor of this war. This news will not be good for morale...

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The response is terrible. Not only are the gods against us in this war but, according to the signs interpreted by the diviner, they seem to be favoring our enemies!

As [From.GetFirstName] is dragged away from the main hall yelling and cursing, [From.GetSheHe] swears that [From.GetSheHe] will one day return to enact [From.GetHerHis] vengeance and take what [From.GetSheHe] considers to be [From.GetHerHis] birthright by force.

[From.GetFirstName] is dragged away from the main hall screaming and wailing, claiming that spending the remainder of [From.GetHerHis] life cloistered with peasants is a destiny unfitting for a [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] lineage.

Breaking the news to [From.GetFirstName] is not easy. We have a long fight, exchanging a few harsh words, before [From.GetSheHe] finally understands that there is nothing [From.GetSheHe] can do to change my mind and that [From.GetSheHe] must accept [From.GetHerHis] fate in the monastery.

Breaking the news to [From.GetFirstName] is not easy. [From.GetSheHeCap] wastes a few tears before finally understanding that there is nothing [From.GetSheHe] can do to change my mind and that [From.GetSheHe] must accept [From.GetHerHis] fate in seclusion.

[From.GetFirstName] takes the news of [From.GetHerHis] cloistering fairly well. [From.GetSheHeCap] tells me that [From.GetSheHe] understands my reasons and that, if it is my desire to have [From.GetHerHim] languish the rest of [From.GetHerHis] days in a monastery, [From.GetSheHe] will readily obey.

[From.GetFirstName] takes the news of [From.GetHerHis] cloistering fairly well. [From.GetSheHeCap] tells me that [From.GetSheHe] understands my reasons and that, if it is my desire to have [From.GetHerHim] languish the rest of [From.GetHerHis] days in seclusion, [From.GetSheHe] will readily obey.
This was not an easy choice to make...
The pillaging of [From.GetName] has been very fruitful. Our warriors have gathered many prisoners amongst the populace that look fit to become good thralls.
They will serve the gods in the afterlife!
They will fetch us a good price...
We will have them shipped back to [Root.Capital.GetName]...
The monstrous raiders led by [From.GetTitledFirstName] have slaughtered many of the people of [FromFrom.GetName], flooding the streets with blood in order to appease their wicked idols.
[From.GetName] was filled with horses and cattle. Our raiders have rounded up a large flock in the main square so that I can decide which ones to pick for myself and what to do with them.
I will offer them to the gods. Burn them!
I will take the best specimens.
I will share the cattle with my best warriors.

My raiders have stormed the walls of [From.GetName] and overwhelmed the local garrison. With the defenders dead or forced to retreat, we have gained free access to the entire coast of this province. The many riches of [From.Location.County.GetName] are ours for the taking!
Burn it all to the ground! Leave nothing but bones and ashes!
Search for anything of value, leave no stone unturned!
Let the peasants go! Let them spread the legend of [Root.GetFirstName]!

The vile raider [From.GetTitledFirstName] has pillaged [FromFrom.GetName] to the ground. Many of his warriors, taken by greed and a bloodthirsty frenzy have destroyed several buildings and killed scores of people in their search for riches.

Many brave Norsemen sail from Scandinavia in search for glory and riches in the prosperous lands of the West. Only a few return from their travels as heroes, but even their stories pale in comparison to mine. \nMy palace is filled with the countless trophies I have gathered through a lifetime of endless plundering. I have laid waste of scores of towns, killed thousands, brought entire realms to their knees... \nThe land-dwellers scare children by telling stories about my exploits, while the Skalds of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] swear that I must be the son of an Aesir, animated by an unquenchable thirst for blood and conquest.

Many brave Norsemen sail from Scandinavia in search for glory and riches in the prosperous lands of the West. Only a few return from their travels as heroes, but even their stories pale in comparison to mine. \nMy palace is filled with the countless trophies I have gathered through a lifetime of endless plundering. I have laid waste of scores of towns, killed thousands, brought entire realms to their knees... \nThe land-dwellers scare children by telling stories about my exploits, while the Skalds of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] swear that I must be nothing less than a Valkyr, descended from Valhalla to quench my thirst for battle.

Many raiders plague the coasts of the civilized realms, scraping by robbing traders and fishermen. Only a few are skilled enough to make a name for themselves and become notorious pirates, but even their stories pale in comparison to mine. \nMy palace is filled with the countless trophies I have gathered through a lifetime of endless plundering. I have laid waste of scores of towns, killed thousands, brought entire realms to their knees... \nThe land-dwellers scare children by telling stories about my exploits, talking of me as some sort of demon risen from the cold abyss of the ocean to drag their entire civilization towards a cold and terrifying end.

There are many raiders plaguing our shores, but none have become as infamous as [From.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Common folks are afraid to even mention [From.GetHerHis] name, thinking of this [From.GetManWoman] as some sort of sea-demon, stalking the cold depths of seas and rivers, waiting to strike at unsuspecting preys. \nAccording to the stories, this ravager leads an army of drowned men and controls a giant wyrm. [From.GetSheHeCap] is said to have killed thousands and burned entire realms to the ground.

My warriors are already sprawling through the streets of [From.GetName] to take their hard-fought loot, when I receive news that there is still a pocket of defenders hiding in the area. It is a small band of mercenaries, led by a [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetManWoman] called [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetFirstName]. Their leader claims that [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetSheHe] has no quarrel with us, and would in fact be ready to join my army for the right price.
Perhaps we can come to a better arrangement?
I challenge you for leadership of your band!
I have no need of you. Begone.

It is not hard to persuade [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetFirstName]. All it takes is a few kind words, firm hands and some time alone in a burned-out hut. Once I am done with [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetHerHim], [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetSheHe] is more than willing to follow my army for free.

It is not hard to persuade [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetFirstName]. All it takes is a revealing gesture here and there, a well-placed compliment and some time alone in a burned-out hut. Once I am done with [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetHerHim], [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetSheHe] is more than willing to follow my army for free.
Silly little [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetManWoman]... I do not need your permission!
You are quite charming yourself... Why do not we join forces permanently?
This is a fair price, isn't it?

For whatever reason, [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetFirstName] does not look interested in what I have to offer [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetHerHim]. In fact, my attempts to reach a better arrangement has only managed to upset [scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetHerHim].
Never mind, I will just pay you...
Then get lost. I do not need you!

[scoped_pirate_mercenary.GetFirstName]'s band has grown weary of following me. They claim that they are not receiving their rightful share of loot from our raids. If I do not bribe them with some of my treasure, they will surely leave.
Very well... Here is your gold.
You dare make demands of me?! Begone!
Having proven my worth by defeating their leader, the remaining mercenaries have flocked under my banner, fearing to meet the same end as their former commander.
I am not to be trifled with.

There must be some way to force open the defenses of [From.GetName]. With control over both land and sea, I have a distinct advantage over the defenders of this fortress. I only need to think of a good idea...

There must be some way to get into [From.GetName]. The city might be well defended, but with control over both land and sea, I have a distinct advantage over my opponents, while they have to defend a very large area of territory. I only need to think of a good idea...

There must be some way to get into [From.GetName]. Our opponents are nothing but priests, and we have control over both land and sea. We have a distinct advantage over our enemies... If only I could think of a plan to get us past their walls.
I full assault, from land and sea, will crack their defenses!
With a few robes, I am sure some of us can sneak inside...
I am sure I can get us past the guards.
We will spread and pillage the countryside.
No need to risk my men needlessly. We will wait.

With attackers coming from both land and sea, the defenders of [FromFrom.GetName] are unable to divide their attention between our assaults. My raiders are able to slip through their palisades and kill many of them before being repelled.
Unfortunately, dividing my men between land and sea proved to be a bad decision. The defenders of [FromFrom.GetName] were able to repel our assault before we could cause any significant damage.

With just a few robes and some well-placed bribes, I was able to sneak inside [FromFrom.GetName] with a few veteran warriors. Now that the priests are busy tending to their rites, we have the perfect opportunity to raid this temple.
Forget raiding, we must desecrate this temple in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s name!

Unfortunately, the priests were able to see through our disguise. While their attempt to capture us failed miserably, when we returned to the camp to bring the news to the rest of the band, the other raiders were not happy to see we had returned empty-handed.
We will be more direct next time...

Convincing the guards to let me through might have not been my most dignified moment, but the trick worked. I was able to slip past their defenses and open the gates to the rest of my men, who quickly rushed inside. We killed many of [FromFrom.GetName]'s defenders before being forced to retreat.
All in a good night's work!
Unfortunately, I was unable to convince the guards to let me through. After a while, I was forced to leave entirely before risking to raise their suspicions too much.
This was just a waste of time...
My raiders scattered through the countryside, pillaging the villages and farms nearby [FromFrom.GetName] and returning at nightfall to our camp, their bags filled with food and other loot.
Unfortunately, my raiders returned to the camp empty-handed. Apparently they were unable to find anything of substance in the farms around [FromFrom.GetName].

After having consulted with some of the world's most respected diviners and having analyzed sightings from several realms, I have come to the conclusion that we are entering into a new prosperous age. \nThe skies are clear, the weather is stable, and the stars have aligned favorably, ensuring stability, abundance and overall good luck throughout the land.\nBeing the [Root.GetTitle], it is my duty to spread the good news to all the great [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers.

After having consulted with some of the world's most respected diviners and having analyzed sightings from several realms, I have come to the conclusion that we are entering into a favorable period of our time. \nThe skies are clear, the weather is stable, no misalignment of the heavenly bodies threatens us with doom.\nBeing the [Root.GetTitle], it is my duty to communicate these good findings to all the notable [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers.

Despite having consulted with some of the world's most respected diviners and having analyzed sightings from several realms, I have yet to come to a conclusion regarding the future of our world. \nThe omens have been ambiguous and contradictory at every turn, and none of us has been able to give a clear interpretation of the message hidden in the heavens above. \nBeing the [Root.GetTitle], it is my duty to warn the notable [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers that misfortune might be imminent.

After having consulted with some of the world's most respected diviners and having analyzed sightings from several realms, I have come to the conclusion that we are facing the beginning of a dreadful time. \nThe signs are clear: comets have flashed through the sky, misaligning the stars into unfavorable patterns, there have been accounts of two-headed children being born and other such prodigious omens, all pointing at a terrible future.\nBeing the [Root.GetTitle], it is my duty to inform all the notable [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers of this news, so that they may take all the necessary precautions to protect their subjects.

After having consulted with some of the world's most respected diviners and having analyzed sightings from several realms, I have come to the conclusion that the end times might be approaching. \nThe signs could not be clearer: long periods of sudden darkness have followed prodigious sightings of two-headed children and storms of fire. Rivers are drying up, crops are bleeding as clouds of blasphemous vermin encircle our lands, harbingers of our impending doom.\nBeing the [Root.GetTitle], it is my duty to inform all the notable [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers of this apocalyptic news, so that they may take all the necessary precautions to protect their subjects.
There must be a better interpretation to these signs...
This is nothing but superstitious nonsense!
Ignore your findings and keep them hidden from everybody.

We have just received news from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. A most revered congregation of diviners under the leadership of our [From.GetTitle] have analyzed the stars and many prodigious heavenly sightings happening all over the world in the past months, and have reached the conclusion that a period of unbridled prosperity is upon us.\nThe skies are clear, the weather is stable, and the stars have aligned favorably, ensuring stability, abundance and overall good luck throughout the land.

We have just received news from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. A most revered congregation of diviners under the leadership of our [From.GetTitle] have analyzed the stars and many prodigious heavenly sightings happening all over the world in the past months, and have reached the conclusion that a period of good luck and stability is approaching us.\nThe skies are clear, the weather is stable, no misalignment of the heavenly bodies threatens us with doom.

We are receiving scants reports from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] about infighting amongst our most illustrious diviners. \nIt appears that a series of ambiguous and contradictory sightings that have confused our priests as well as the [From.GetTitle] [From.GetHerselfHimself]. \nWith the heavens hiding our future, many amongst us are being beset by doubt and fearfulness.

We have just received news from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. A most revered congregation of diviners under the leadership of our [From.GetTitle] have analyzed the stars and many prodigious heavenly sightings happening all over the world in the past months, and have reached the conclusion that a period of bad luck and instability is upon us.\nThe signs are clear: comets have flashed through the sky, misaligning the stars into unfavorable patterns, there have been accounts of two-headed children being born and other such prodigious omens, all pointing at a terrible future.

We have just received news from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. A most revered congregation of diviners under the leadership of our [From.GetTitle] have analyzed the stars and many prodigious heavenly sightings happening all over the world in the past months, and have reached the conclusion that a period of terrible misfortune is upon us.\nThe signs could not be clearer: long periods of sudden darkness have followed prodigious sightings of two-headed children and storms of fire. Rivers are drying up, crops are bleeding as clouds of blasphemous vermin encircle our lands, harbingers of our impending doom.
I will make a great offering to protect my realm!

It looked like such a clear, sunny day... Yet, just as I stepped outside of my palace, a sudden flash of light enveloped me, sending shivers down my spine and filling my ears with an unsettling ringing.

The fire started during the night, just as I finished my last function. All the other priests had already left the building, leaving me alone and with no help. \nI clutch my holy symbol, languishing in a corner as the flames and smoke draw near.

It is such a hot day in [Root.Capital.GetName]. I can barely breathe. I am discussing some menial theological issue with one of my clerics, when the [Root.GetManWoman] suddenly shrieks and jumps away from me. I look down, suddenly realizing that I am on fire.

I shudder in my sleep and let out a muffled scream, seeing the [Root.GetRegionalBigAnimal] staring at me from the other side of the room. Before I can even stand up or call for help, the creature leaps forward, pouncing on me.
How could I not realize that the walls' edge was so close? At the very least, my shame will be very short-lived.

The most disturbing news is spreading through the realm. Our revered [From.GetTitledFirstName] has recently died, struck by lightning during a sunny day. \nPeople are clamoring that this is surely a sign of divine wrath towards [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

The most disturbing news is spreading through the realm. Our revered [From.GetTitledFirstName] has recently died, consumed by a fire that destroyed [From.GetHerHis] great temple. \nPeople are clamoring that this is surely a sign of divine wrath towards [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

The most disturbing news is spreading through the realm. Our revered [From.GetTitledFirstName] has recently spontaneously combusted during a theological debate. \nPeople are clamoring that this is surely a sign of divine wrath towards [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

The most disturbing news is spreading through the realm. Our revered [From.GetTitledFirstName] has recently died, eaten by a dragon in [From.GetHerHis] own palace. \nPeople are clamoring that this is surely a sign of divine wrath towards [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

The most disturbing news is spreading through the realm. Our revered [From.GetTitledFirstName] has recently died after being caught by a strong wind that tossed [From.GetHerHim] into an abyss. \nPeople are clamoring that this is surely a sign of divine wrath towards [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

After spending the last year scrutinizing the stars, looking for divine signs, I am confident that the realm is about to enter a period of prosperity and stability. I should inform my liege about my findings.

After spending the last year scrutinizing the stars, looking for divine signs, I have come to the conclusion that the future of the realm is uncertain and that there might be supernatural threats looming over the horizon. I should inform my liege about my findings.

After spending the last year scrutinizing the stars, looking for divine signs, I have come to the conclusion that a period of doom and misfortune is approaching our realm. I should inform my liege about my findings.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] informed me that, after a careful analysis of the celestial bodies, [From.GetSheHe] has come to the conclusion that our realm is favored by the stars and is about to enter a period of prosperity and good luck.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] informed me that, after a careful analysis of the celestial bodies, [From.GetSheHe] has come to the conclusion that our realm is entering a phase of uncertainty and uneasiness.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] informed me that, after a careful analysis of the celestial bodies, [From.GetSheHe] has come to the conclusion that our realm is unfavored by the stars and will soon enter a period of misfortune and bad luck.
A great sacrifice should endear us to the heavenly powers!
The fire started during the night, just as I finished my hearing. Despite all my yelling, no guard came to my rescue. \nAs I languish in a corner, the flames and smoke draw nearer and nearer.

It is such a hot day in [Root.Capital.GetName]. I can barely breathe. I am discussing some menial issue with one of my courtiers, when the [Root.GetManWoman] suddenly shrieks and jumps away from me. I look down, suddenly realizing that I am on fire.

[From.GetFirstName] should be baptized as soon as possible so that [From.GetHerHis] place in Heaven can be assured. Given that [From.GetSheHe] is a [From.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I should make sure that the rite celebrating [From.GetHerHis] coming into this world as a [Root.Religion.GetName] is as grandiose as possible.
On the other hand, maybe a regular baptism will do...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] was a notable and prestigious [From.GetManWoman]. My priests are of the opinion that performing a divination on [From.GetHerHis] very entrails would yield much more accurate results than on any other lesser creature.
Do not bother yourselves. I can learn the future by eating them!
I know exactly how to proceed.
Very well. Let us see what the future has in store for me...

The flesh of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] filled me with unearthly strength. As I consumed [FromFrom.GetHerHis] entrails, the gods sent me a prophetic vision, assuring me of a great victory in the near future.

Although [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s flesh did not grant me any greater insight on the future of my realm, it did give me solace from my recent sickness. Clearly, the gods wished me to consume it in order to regain my health.

Although [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s flesh did not grant me any greater insight on the future of my realm, it cleared my mind and awakened my body. Clearly, the gods wished me to consume it in order to regain my health.

Unfortunately, consuming my enemy's entrails did not allow me to hear the voice of the gods. It is [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] who started speaking instead. [FromFrom.GetHerHisCap] vengeful spirit has taken place within my head, tormenting me with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] incessant yelling.

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Their final verdict is that a great military victory is in store in my near future.
Marvelous! We shall inform the troops at once!

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Little by little, they are able to read the names of several people who wish me ill and are plotting against me.
I will heed the gods' warning!

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Little by little, they are able to read several secrets held by my enemies through the knotted remains of the dead [FromFrom.GetManWoman].
I shall put them to good use.

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Their final verdict is that the gods were very satisfied by [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s death and will reward my realm with prosperity and good luck.

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Unfortunately, they are unable to read anything meaningful from the corpse.

The diviners rummage intently through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails for about an hour, soiling the temple's floor with blood and gastric fluids, while I supervise them from a safe distance. Unfortunately, their final verdict is that the gods have been insulted by my sacrifice and will surely curse me.

By taking the lead on my diviners rummaging through [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s entrails and examining every nob and knot, I am able to discern the most endearing of results. It appears that the gods were extremely pleased by my sacrifice and have elected me to be the champion of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.

I leave the altar with my clothes still dripping of the blood of my last victim. After having officiated a few sacrificial rites, I have found that my hands are much steadier, and that my heart is much more impervious to the incoherent pleas of my offerings to the gods.

There might have been a time when the sight of blood unsettled me, or when the wailing of a child could make my dagger quake and fill my mind with dread. \nBut not any longer. \nThe gods have granted me the fortitude to perform their sacred work.
The crowd below me cheers as the head of my last sacrifice rolls down the steps of the temple. I throw the heart in the sacred brazier, watching it hiss and burn and singing praises to the gods.

[Root.Religion.GetName] priests are notorious throughout the world for their sanguinary practices. The many sacrifices performed in the name of our gods are an imperative necessity, a grim responsibility that every pious man must take part in if we wish to avoid the terrible wrath of our immortal masters.\nYet, few can deny that my accomplishments in sating the gods' eternal thirst tower above those of all my colleagues.\nThrough my faith and dedication, I have cleansed the entirety of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in a sea of blood, forging a sacred legacy that will not soon be forgotten.

[From.Religion.GetName] priests are notorious throughout the world for their sanguinary practices. The barbaric sacrifices performed in the name of their gods are a notorious staple of their dogma.\nAnd yet, in spite of their infamy, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to surprise the world with [From.GetHerHis] unfathomable atrocities. \nIn [From.GetHerHis] twisted quest for the blessing of [From.GetHerHis] immortal masters, this vile murderer has forged a realm of blood and skulls, slaughtering thousands of innocent and feeding their souls to [From.GetHerHis] monstrous gods.

[From.Religion.GetName] priests are notorious throughout the world for their sanguinary practices. They consider the many sacrifices that they regularly perform as an imperative necessity, a grim responsibility that every pious man must take part in to avoid the terrible wrath of the gods.\nYet, few can deny that the accomplishments of [From.GetTitledFirstName] in sating the gods' eternal thirst have towered upon those of all of [From.GetHerHis] colleagues.\nThrough [From.GetHerHis] faith and dedication, [From.GetSheHe] has cleansed the entirety of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in a sea of blood, forging a sacred legacy that will not soon be forgotten.

The priests drag [From.GetTitledFirstName] screaming to the top of the temple and they keep [From.GetHerHim] steady on the altar while I slice [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. I then tear out [From.GetHerHis] still beating heart to the cheers of the assembled crowd.

It is decided. In a few weeks, a great tournament shall be held to honor the gods. Of the many who will fight, only one will be acclaimed as the chosen of the gods, while the others will be immolated to sate the eternal thirst for blood of our immortal masters and protect the rest of us from their wrath.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You have been invited formally invited to assist to the next blood games organized by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. As a member of the [Root.Religion.GetName] nobility, you are encouraged to contribute with fighters from your own dungeons and court.

Distinct Salutations
[From.GetFullName]
How exciting! I will come for sure!
I will be glad to assist in the next §YBlood Games§!, my liege.

The gods are sure to show their appreciation to the patron of the warrior who will emerge victorious in the blood games. I should make sure to pick the best candidate to represent my dynasty in the arena...
Get me the toughest of our prisoners.
My most vicious Commander will do.
Is there nobody that wishes to fight for me?

I have been picked to participate to the next Blood Games that are being organized by my jailers to honor the gods. I have no choice in the matter, but the guards assure me that, if I manage to survive, I will earn my freedom.

[my_blood_contender.GetTitledFirstName] will need all the help [my_blood_contender.GetSheHe] can get in order to survive the Blood Games. Perhaps I should try to invest a bit more in [my_blood_contender.GetHerHis] equipment before sending [my_blood_contender.GetHerHim] off to the slaughtering grounds?
I will make a potion to give [my_blood_contender.GetHerHim] strength and courage!
Nothing wrong in poisoning [my_blood_contender.GetHerHis] weapons, surely...
I will give [my_blood_contender.GetHerHim] the best equipment that gold can buy.

With [From.GetTitledFirstName] no longer in my dungeons, I have been left without a fighter to represent my dynasty's faith to the gods in the upcoming blood games. Still, there is a little time left, if I wish to find somebody else to pick up [From.GetHerHis] place.
Herm... You! You there! You will fight for the gods!
Better wait for the next tournament...

With [From.GetTitledFirstName] dead, I have been left without a fighter to represent my dynasty's faith to the gods in the upcoming blood games. Still, there is a little time left, if I wish to find somebody else to pick up [From.GetHerHis] place.

Unfortunately, the gods did not have the patience to wait for [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s Blood Games, and decided to instead reap [From.GetHerHis] very soul last night. Without [From.GetHerHis] patronage, it would appear that the entire tournament has been canceled.

Scores of criminals, slaves and desperate souls have gathered in the arena of [Root.Capital.GetName], hoping to earn the blessing of the gods by becoming the champion of the tournament. I take my place of honor, alongside the rest of the [Root.Religion.GetName] nobility and wait as the priests finish consecrating the ground before the beginning of the games.

Scores of criminals, slaves and desperate souls have gathered in the arena of [From.Capital.GetName], hoping to earn the blessing of the gods by becoming the champion of the tournament. I take my place of honor, alongside the rest of the [Root.Religion.GetName] nobility and wait as the priests finish consecrating the ground before the beginning of the games.

The crowd roars in approval as another warrior falls to the ground, defeated. The weakest contenders have been quickly disposed of, leaving space for the more experienced fighters, and blessing the ground of the arena with their blood. Soon, their remains will be burned to honor the gods.

It was a gruesome trial to say the least, but, as I look up from the mangled remains of my last opponent and bask in the cheering of the crowd, my heart is filled with relief. I have emerged victorious from the Blood Games, proving my worth to the murderous gods of [From.Capital.GetName] and earning eternal glory.

As my opponent pushes me on the ground and stomps on my wrist, a flash of pain courses through my body, making me lose my weapon. The crowd cheers and my opponent leaves. Then, the priests come, dragging me away from the arena and towards the bloodied altar.

As the dust settles and the crowd cheers dissipate, the priests escort [From.GetTitledFirstName] up to the arena's main balcony in order to congratulate [From.GetHerHim] for [From.GetHerHis] victory. Through [From.GetHerHis] actions, many souls have been delivered to the gods today, and by [From.GetHerHis] victory, [From.GetSheHe] has undoubtedly blessed the name of my dynasty.

As the dust settles and the crowd cheers dissipate, the priests escort [From.GetTitledFirstName] up to the arena's main balcony in order to congratulate [From.GetHerHim] for [From.GetHerHis] victory. Even though [From.GetSheHe] was not my offering, through [From.GetHerHis] actions, many souls have been delivered to the gods today, placating their ire.
I knew [From.GetSheHe] was the chosen one!
I will have to pick a better candidate next time...

As the dust settles and the crowd cheers dissipate, the priests escort [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] up to the arena's main balcony in order to congratulate [FromFrom.GetHerHim] for [FromFrom.GetHerHis] victory. Even though [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was not my offering, through [FromFrom.GetHerHis] actions, many souls have been delivered to the gods today, placating their ire.

Now that I have abandoned the murderous cult of the [From.GetName] followers, I can finally see how horrible the idea of a blood tournament really is, and I have therefore decided to cancel the event immediately.

With [From.GetHerHis] recent conversion, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided that the Blood Games are a barbarous and terrible practice and has therefore decided to cancel the tournament [From.GetSheHe] had been organizing.
Maybe it is for the best...

Victory cannot be achieved without the protection of the gods. If we wish to prevail against our enemies, we must be willing to make the required sacrifices. Once the gods have been appeased, they will unleash their terrible power against our foes.
All of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] will run with blood!
We shall scour every village for our tribute!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has performed a great sacrifice, slaughtering hundreds of our own people to garner the favor of the gods during this war. With such a large offering, we are sure to prevail against our foes.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has performed a great sacrifice, slaughtering hundreds of our own people to garner the favor of the gods during this war. [From.GetHerHisCap] fanatic obsession with human sacrifice will doom us all.
Aren't our enemies killing enough people already?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has performed a great sacrifice, slaughtering hundreds of our own people to garner the favor of the gods during this war. [From.GetSheHeCap] hopes that the gods will now grant [From.GetHerHis] armies the strength necessary to defeat my warriors.
What if the gods listened to [From.GetHerHim]?

The pillaging and looting undertaken in your name has earned you a reputation as a fearsome Pirate. All along the coasts, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible [Root.GetFirstName], scourge of the seas, will come ashore with [Root.GetHerHis] undead warriors and eat them.

Few alive have a more fearsome reputation than you. Where many Pirates merely raid you destroy entire towns and castles, leaving none alive besides one to spread the tale of [Root.GetFirstName] the Ravager.
I cannot stand [From.GetTitledFirstName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] takes every opportunity to insult and berate me. Clearly, this [From.GetManWoman] wishes to be my enemy.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] thoroughly hates me by now and likely wishes me dead. The feeling is, of course, mutual.
We shall be enemies to the end!

I have decided that it might be profitable to take some time and resources and try to seriously hurt my sworn enemy. \n[From.GetTitledFirstName] is an unbearable pestilence upon this world, and I will not rest until I will have made [From.GetHerHis] life a living hell.
I will spread false reports to [From.GetHerHis] spies.
I will spread the most vile rumors about [From.GetHerHim]!
[From.GetSheHeCap] shall never know peace for as long as I live!
Better to bide my time for now...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has unleashed [From.GetHerHis] spies throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. These thugs have been spreading false news to my own informants, bringing my spy network in disarray. It has become increasingly harder to trust anything these days...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is at it again, dragging [From.GetHerHis] own name through the mud as long as [From.GetSheHe] is able of besmirching mine in the process. [From.GetSheHeCap] is spreading the most disgusting rumors about me, trying to pit my own subjects against me.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is unbearable. [From.GetSheHeCap] wastes no occasion to mock and berate me, insulting my dynasty and my friends without pause. I do not know how much longer I will be able to endure this relentless barrage of abuse.

Following my actions, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has started spreading false reports of [From.GetHerHis] own. It appears that the efficacy of my own network of informants has been compromised, at least for the time being...

By carving this imposing Irminsul Tree, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and fierce gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By the construction of this sacred Ovoo Shrine, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and wild gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving our new Great Pillar, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and unyielding gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By consecrating an Hiisi Grove, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and mysterious gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving this Great Totem, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing upon our tribes the protection of many benevolent spirits. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving this imposing Totem with the remains of our sacrifices, we have provided the gods with a great offering, buying us some reprieve from their terrible thirst for blood. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving this great monument, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and benevolent gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving this opulent shrine to the Sun, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

By carving this imposing [GetZeusJupiterName] Column, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and dignified gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has ordered the construction of a great monument to worship the old gods and garner their favor. This magnificent shrine has been erected in [From.Capital.GetName], where many shamans, fortunetellers and petitioners have already started to gather, hoping to receive a divine vision.
The old gods still protect us!

As my soldiers overrun the province, I receive a report regarding a curious shrine built at the center of [From.GetName]. Apparently, the local tribes have erected it to garner the favor of their gods, and consider it to be a most sacred symbol.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has laid waste of the Great Pillar of [From.GetName]. [From.GetHerHisCap] soldiers have torn down this sacred monument to the old gods. Having proved unable to protect their holy shrine, we have proven ourselves unworthy of the favor of the gods, who have surely turned their backs on us after this ignominious event.

For too long I have allowed this old, blasphemous relic to pollute my lands and cast its grotesque shadow upon the good people of [From.GetName]. The wailing of the few stubborn old believers fill the air as my soldiers tear down the pillar and scatter its remains to the open fields, never to be found ever again.

It was only a matter of time before the [From.Religion.GetName] followers torn down the old idol of [FromFrom.GetName]. [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s guards have come today, in the early afternoon, announcing that the great pillar was a blasphemous remnant of a dead cult and needed to be removed forever.

It would not be appropriate to continue celebrations after the death of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. The festival has been therefore canceled to allow the [From.GetTitle]'s close ones to properly mourn [From.GetHerHis] loss.
With a war brewing on the horizon, we must set aside all frivolous activities and prepare for battle. I must therefore regretfully cancel the festival of [Root.Capital.GetName].
We will celebrate our victory later!

With a war brewing on the horizon, we must set aside all frivolous activities and prepare for battle. In light of this troubling new event, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has had to regretfully cancel the festival of [From.Capital.GetName].

A great festival is exactly what the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] need to strengthen the bonds with their fellow tribesmen. It will also be a great opportunity for the Chieftains to bring offerings to our ancestors, bringing prosperity to our lands.

Greetings,
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
A great festival is being held at [From.Capital.GetName]. You are hereby invited to join us alongside your family to celebrate our fortune and bring our offerings to our great ancestors.
Signed,

[From.GetFullName]
I will be glad to join you for the §YGreat Festival§!, my liege.

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

I have heard news of the great celebration you are preparing for your fellow tribesmen. I wager you'd enjoy the company of a fellow warrior to exchange stories with.

Signed, [From.GetFullName]

The period of festivities is about to start. All sorts of peddlers, bards and fortunetellers are gathering in [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], bringing their tales and offerings. I should make sure to prepare myself before traveling to meet my tribesmen.

The period of festivities is about to start. All sorts of peddlers, bards and fortunetellers are gathering in [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], bringing their tales and offerings. This is surely going to be a great opportunity to meet new people and learn new games.
I think I will go hunting...
I will take time to groom myself.
I will study our old legends.
I will look for our best craftsmen.
I do not need to worry about anything.
This is going to be amazing!

The celebrations have finally begun. [Root.Capital.GetName] is bustling with activity: people from every corner of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have traveled here to pay their respects to me and my ancestors, exchange tales and goods, and have a good time.

The celebrations have finally begun. [From.Capital.GetName] is bustling with activity: people from every corner of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have traveled here to pay their respects to [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetHerHis] ancestors, exchange tales and goods, and have a good time.

A hoarse voice calls for my name from the crowd of peddlers, catching my attention. An old Seer is waiting for me sitting near an old runic stone. He claims that he will read my future for a small price.

An old woman suddenly jumps in my line of sight, giving me a toothless smile and shaking a cup filled with dice. She claims that she can determine what the stars have in store for me, for the right price.

As I am appraising some of the merchandise of the travelers drawn to the festival, I meet the unsettling gaze of a weird boy in tatters. The kid approaches me slowly, ignoring the crowd bustling with activity around him, and whispers that he can read me my future for just a small price.
I have no time for this nonsense!
The fortuneteller surprises me by predicting that extraordinary opportunities are about to present themselves to me in my near future, and I need only to pay close attention to find my good fortune.
I always knew I was born lucky!
The fortuneteller assures me that a period of good luck is just around the corner, and that I need only look for the right opportunities in order to change my life for the better.

After giving a thorough look to the signs, the fortuneteller warns me that my future looks grim and I should be very careful about my next choices to avoid any calamity befalling upon me and my family.

As I walk around the crowded streets of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], a strange aroma catches my attention, leading me to the obscure stand of an old alchemist. Seeing my curiosity, the man shows me some of his wares and their prodigious effects.
How about a drink for this charm?
I will burn an offering for you, in exchange for this perfume.
Never mind, I am not interested in what you sell.
I will burn an offering for you, in exchange for this amulet.
I do not need any of this sorcery.

An old merchant has set up a large stand in the middle of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName] this year, selling all sorts of amulets and trinkets to use at the end of the festival as offerings to the gods of our ancestors. I wonder if I should buy something to burn myself...
The most expensive jewels are the least I can offer.
If I really *have* to buy something...
I have no money to waste.

I stumbled on [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetTitledFirstName] in the main hall with a group of other distinguished guests. I have heard quite a few good things about [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHim] in the past, and I wonder if this festival is the right occasion to earn [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHis] friendship.
Let me offer you a drink, [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] and I spent the evening telling old tales of our clans to each other, having a very good time alongside the other guests of [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s feast. I never noticed how likable [From.GetFirstName] was before...
But what does [From.GetSheHe] *really* wants from me?
We should do this again, sometimes.

For some reason, [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] has entirely rejected my offer of friendship. I think [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHis] paranoid nature might have gotten the best of [tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetHerHim]...

[tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] spent a great evening in the long-house, telling old legends and drinking with the other tribesmen. When finally leaving, right before dawn, we swore an oath of friendship.
We should do this more often!

[tribal_festival_potential_friend_1.GetFirstName] and I spent a very pleasant evening in the long-house, telling old legends and drinking with the other tribesmen. We left the hall at dawn, both glad to have had this opportunity to strengthen our relation.

I was busy exchanging tales with some of the other tribesmen, when [From.GetTitledFirstName] approaches me with a smile, offering me a drink, claiming that [From.GetSheHe] wishes to make a toast to new friendships.
What?! What's your angle? Is it poisoned?!

Seeing [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName] having such a good time with the other tribesmen, laughing and drinking in the long-house, is an unbearable sight. I wish I could do something to bring [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHis] insufferable merriment to an end.
Never mind, I will just have to ignore [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHim]...

It looks like [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetFirstName] is smarter than [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetSheHe] looks. [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetSheHeCap] was able to see through my deception and reject my false offer of friendship.
Oh well... I guess that's it for tonight then.

Just as I hoped, I was able to get [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetTitledFirstName] completely drunk and isolate [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHim] from [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetHerHis] friends. Now is the time to reveal my true intentions...
Shame on you! What sort of [tribal_festival_potential_enemy_1.GetManWoman] are you?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] fooled me! After getting me drunk, [From.GetSheHe] abandoned me in the wilderness, in the dead of night. I am too tired and confused to find my way back to the tribe, and I think I hear something growling nearby...

I do not understand. One moment [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I are having fun, drinking and exchanging tales, and the moment after [From.GetSheHe] is insulting me, shaming me for being nothing but a drunken fool in front of everybody.
Whu-? I thought we were friends...

We were all happily celebrating our good fortune in [great_tribal_festival_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s long-house, when [From.GetTitledFirstName] decided to ruin the mood of the feast by yelling my name and showering me with insults, clearly trying to upset me.

I have received several complaints from my guests in the last days regarding [warrior_lodge_guest.GetTitledFirstName]. Apparently, [warrior_lodge_guest.GetSheHe] has been going around town, picking fights, bragging about [warrior_lodge_guest.GetHerHis] great feats and shaming my own tribesmen for lacking in strength and courage.
I am sure we can solve this series of misunderstandings...

The priests are preparing a large feast to offer to our ancestors tonight. I have been spying at the servants bringing in the offerings in the great hall for some time. Some of my friends have dared me to see if I can sneak in and out under the priests' noses without being spotted.

I am only a few step into the main hall when I hear somebody call for me. One of the priests has spotted me! With my face growing red, I manage to run away just in time to avoid being caught. My playmates welcome me with a shower of chuckles.

With just a bit of care, I manage to sneak past the servants and get into the main hall. The weird statues of the ancestors are all assembled near the long table, decorated with trinkets and surrounded by food.

I was surprised to hear that the statues in the temple of [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName] have moved to a nefarious position. The priests wander around town informing everyone of the prodigious event for several hour before news comes out that the misplacement was just the result of [From.GetFirstName] sneaking into the temple and rearranging them.

[From.GetFirstName] managed to sneak into the temple and rearrange the positions of the ancestors' statues! Even better, the old priests thought that the statues had moved by themselves and went screaming around town that a terrible calamity was about to strike all of us before they learned the truth and became the laughing stock of town.

[From.GetFirstName] and some of [From.GetHerHis] playmates have stolen the offerings for tonight's feast of the ancestors. The priests were furious to find the little piglets sleeping in the woods near [great_tribal_festival_host.Capital.GetName], surrounded by the remains of their loot.

[From.GetFirstName] managed to sneak inside the temple and steal some of the offerings for the ancestors. [From.GetSheHeCap] them brought them outside of town and shared them with the rest of us. We spent the rest of the evening laughing at the grown-ups wandering around the tribe, trying to understand what happened to the missing food.
And now we have to pay for more offerings...

A particularly wealthy and obnoxious merchant has been drawn to town due to the great festival, and one of my playmates has challenged me to steal one of his trinkets while he is distracted haggling, to make up for all the times that he mistreated us children in the past.
I will take the biggest jewel from his stand!

Just as I stretch my arm to pick the item from the stand, the merchant grabs me by the wrist and pushes me aside, warning me to keep away from his wares. Trying again now that he has been put on alert would just be a waste of time, so I am forced to return to my playmates empty-handed.

It takes just a few moments of distraction for me to snatch one of the merchant's amulets and run away in the crowd before he can even realize that he has been robbed. I return triumphant to my playmates, and we spend the rest of the afternoon looking from a safe distance the old merchant scrambling through his wares, trying to find the missing trinket.

Today's festivities were disrupted by the complaints of a foreign merchant. The old man spent most of the afternoon claiming that one of the town's kids had stolen a precious amulet from his stand and would not leave until he received compensation for his losses.

A particularly wealthy and obnoxious merchant has been drawn to town due to the great festival. Whenever he comes to town, he is always mean to me and my playmates, so, this year, we decided to get even with him. [From.GetFirstName] snuck behind his stand while he was distracted and stole one of his most precious trinkets, leaving the old merchant to spend the rest of the day looking for it.
Fine. Take this money and leave.
